newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Taiwan sells 3-pct fuel around $121 for Dec 15-27.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan sells 3-pct fuel around $121 for Dec 15-27.

text.p: Taiwan's state-owned Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) sold by tender two 30,000-tonne cargoes of 3.0-percent sulphur fuel oil at around $121 per tonne, a CPC source said on Tuesday.
The cargoes are for December 15-27 liftings, on a free-on-board (fob) basis from Kaohsiung. The tender closed on November 18 and was valid until November 19.
CPC last sold a high sulphur fuel oil cargo for November 14-18 lifting to a western trader near $120 per tonne, fob Kaohsiung.
